info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued October 02 at 5:01PM MDT until October 02 at 5:45PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: The National Weather Service in Grand Junction has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southwestern Mesa County in west central Colorado... Southeastern Grand County in east central Utah... * Until 545 PM MDT. * At 500 PM MDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 23 miles west of Fruita to 19 miles northeast of Castle Valley to 13 miles east of Spanish Valley, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. Accumulating hail may occur on roadways and create hazardous driving conditions. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * These severe thunderstorms will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Mesa and southeastern Grand Counties, including the following locations... Gateway. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Utah between mile markers 218 and 223. Colorado 141 between mile markers 100 and 123. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
